content.description: Squat start on two sidepulls: one on the outside arete and the other in the middle of the north face. From there, use tiny crimps, and undercling and a horn on the arete to reach the pyramid canine tooth at the lip. Once you move over the lip, there is a 12 foot slab to finish up the problem.
content.protection: Pads and spotter. There is a great landing.
content.location: It is on the North side of the boulder.

content.description: Start on the left hand side of the north face on an obvious rail. Move up and right on the rail with positive holds and less than positive feet. The crux is 2/3 in, and the landing gets dicey at best.
content.protection: Multiple pads and a good spotter.
content.location: This is on the North face of Nuptial Block. There's an easy downclimb on the other side.

content.description:
This is an eliminate problem that starts the same as

Epileptic Canine

and minuses the right arete. This totally changes the problem and forces tiny feet to an undercling in the center of the face. Fully eliminating the right arete makes the topout a bit more heady as well.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter, but the landing is like being at the beach.
content.location: Start using right crimps and tiny feet. The downclimb is on the left side, and hop onto another boulder unless you can find a better way. It's not bad, but it's more work than other blocks.

pathTokens: Gateway Vicinity aka The West End
